replyContent: Hi Wilfredo -  BPme currently does NOT accept PIN only debit and pre-paid debit cards. If your card is not a PIN only or pre-paid and you've confirmed all the information is correct, you may want to call your card issuer to ensure there is not an issue with your account. Typically, the customer care phone number is on the back of the credit card.

content:
I am going until the 4th next month if you don't contact if here by the 
First I by phone, I am not going wait for you until the 4th hmm

I was all excited when your Mobile App said it would not only link my BP 
card for rewards but also keep my credit card so I could pay through the 
app - which is what Cumberland Farms has been able to do for years. Since I 
now live several miles from a Cumberland Farms, but only half a mile from 
BP, I figured I could finally stop having to use two cards every time I 
need gas and actually get done in a reasonable amount of time. But no. I 
downloaded the app, linked my cards and found my usual station... Only to 
go thru the whole process and be told they don't accept mobile payments! 
Perhaps that should have been made clear at the onset! The nearest BP that 
does take mobile payments is over 11 miles away -- meanwhile there's at 
least a dozen BP stations in between me and that station. If I'm not 
driving 3 miles to go to Cumberland Farms, why would I go 11? Very 
disappointed in this app. If you're going to offer this, then either 
preface it with "in select locations only" or don't offer it at all. That 
was way more hassle than gassing up needs!
replyContent: Hi Rebecca - We're eager to continue evolving our BPme Rewards program to help meet the demands of important consumers like you. content: The app doesn't appear to recognize when I've made a visit to a station and used my rewards card - BP's website shows the visit and purchase details after logging in, but the app doesn't show that visit when logged in with the same account and navigating to the Receipts screen. replyContent: Hi!  For security reasons, we require the cards to be added to the app separately to confirm that the payment card is valid.  The app currently only shows receipts for transactions completed through the BPme app, however the DR balance in BPme should reflect transactions outside of the app.  Good feedback, we will consider as a future enhancement!

Convenient app that lets you pay at the pump with your smartphone.

You have to turn on Google's tracking service in order to get this thing to work. Simply turning on your location button temporarily won't be enough. Much more importantly, there is no way to get a permanent receipt. You'll get an electronic receipt on your phone which will disappear after 90 days, but there's no way to get the pump to print out a paper receipt. Furthermore there's no way to email your electronic receipts to you or download them in any other way so do you have a permanent record

content: This app is not worth the effort, although it seems like a good idea. There are so many problems it is just easier to get your credit card out. First of all, whenever I launch and log on, it sits at the "circling" cursor for several minutes before eventually timing out and saying there is an error. I can then log on successfully (although this is also pretty slow). Lesson 1: launch the app several minutes before you arrive at the gas station. Second, once I select a pump and a payment method, it takes a very long time to communicate with the backend and activate the pump (assuming it works at all). The last few times I have lost patience waiting for it and just swiped my card! Finally, this morning I tried to use it and it got stuck at the "select payment" step, telling me to "log on" even though I already had. I signed out and back in again... and my saved BP Visa card had vanished from the payment methods. Net: BP needs to fix all of the technical bugs and general lagginess of this app; but it also needs to do a ground-up redesign of the whole flow of the user interaction. This *should* be as easy and convenient as using your phone to checkout at the grocery store, but it's nowhere close.

content: I love this new app and reward program. content: Maybe I am one of those unluckies, it is not worth it. I tried to use it twice in order to leverage Amex promo and I failed terribly both times. First time, I was right by the gas pump, and I can't select the pump number as it showed me being 300 feet away from the gas station, ok, to be fair, this is the collective failure for gps, google map and this app. But I figure you can't just push it out to production without fixing it, right? Do you have to be that accurate? there is NO other BP stations in 5 miles radius, and you can't let me use the ONLY one that is within 300 feet? come on, have some common sense. Second time I was told the very gas station is NOT participating the promo. That 's it, I have removed the app from my phone and will learn my lesson: never use any app for the promo. To respond the response: Yes, I do have the location service activated. Okay, let me share more details with you in a hope that you can improve for other customers. The first incident was at 5930 E State 334, Whitestown IN 46075. It won't let me to select the gas station while I was right by the pump. The second incident was at 1301 Murfreesbora Rd, Franklin TN 37064. This one let me to select the gas station, then told me they don't participate the promo.

replyContent: Hi Diane, cards are removed from your wallet due to security reasons. To avoid losing info, stay logged into your acct and just close the app when finished. This will keep the card info for your next fuel purchase. You'll need to log in each time with either your Pin/Touch ID or Face ID, but your card and account info will be retained. BPme Team

content: One of the worst apps i've ever used. I have been using the app for a couple years now and dealing with the issues since then. If you thinking sitting at the gas station multiple times for 20 or more minutes trying to get the app to work then go ahead and specifically driving to a BP station (there aren't many in my area) to use the app and then it doesn't work. Recently i went to gas up and this is the error i received from the app "we have a problem unlocking your pump. Please try again or speak to one of our staff". Yea i tried about 10 times. I have my paypal account linked so i tried to unlink my paypal account & relink it. No go. I could tell it never even hit paypal because i will receive a $1 pre charge from paypal and i didn't even receive that. Sometimes when i have issues i will see the precharge go across but it will tell me it has been denied. I will call paypal and they will tell me its not on their side. If this only happened 1 or 2 it would be understandable but this is a common occurrence. It seem always close to when the app was updated and they messed stuff up and they randomly it will start working again. So if you think this is work going out of your way to maybe safe $.05 a gallon go ahead. For me i'm deleting it and going to try the shell rewards card and hoping the experience is better. BTW i have tried to talk to them before too and it was a waist of my time

content: Good concept app, maybe a good app if only it worked. Tried registering and signing in couple of months back, and was unsuccessful at at getting it to work. What makes this app so bad is the implementation. Doesn't BP have a testing unit or does nobody test this app before releasing or before releasing an update? I tried to enter my phone number but the text field allows for only 9 digits, and I'm not able to enter the last digit of my phone number. Added my cell phone via the browser profile page, and still get the same prompt upon logging in. FYI, I'm a software engineer living in linux+Android world. content: BP used to be better than Shell at one time, but Shell's app/program has improved & one can still use its card at the pump & pay with Gas Buddy card. It has been truly frustrating using BP me app & fuel rewards program & it has discontinued the card at the pump if one does not have internet or cellular access to get on the network to use the app. Suppose one does not have a phone or data is not available? I recommend using Shell's fuel rewards program as one can still use the card at the pump in case you do not have internet/data access.
